comment._content: The photographer was on board one of the Manly paddle-steamers (PS BRIGHTON?). Interesting to compare the buildings with this 1899 Kerry photo ... [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3041761855/] from.ph/28144

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks BC, you are the leading expert in Sydney's developing skyline! PS I love the review of Macpherson's. This line is a little misleading in a modern context: 'The friends of such as indulge in the weed will find in the handsomely-polished silver-mounted 'cabinets for smokers' most acceptable gifts.'
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Ha ha!  I was trying to establish a date for the whole album.  From the look of it I initially thought late 1880s (Queen Victoria's Golden Jubilee was in 1887), but it seems to be after 1897 (the Diamond Jubilee).  I had been meaning to look into the Holdsworth Macpherson building history for yonks.
